Since 1985, there have been Special Economic Zones in China that are Autonomous from the Chinese Government.
While these SEZs must pay Beijing 25% of their gross profits to exist, their Capitalist style Self Governments usually consist of the CEOs of the Corporations that have made the SEZ their home and workplace, be they Chinese citizens or foreign nationals.
What started as 7 zones in 1986, is now 1,700 SEZs where more than 350 million Chinese live and work.
A huge difference between Communist and Capitalist China is the housing and ability to own land.
In most SEZs there are Condos for those without children and 4-Bedroom 2-Bath Ranch-style Houses, on an acre of land for Families.
Most with 2-Car garages, a Swimming Pool and Sauna, and Outdoor Rec area.
Salaries are in line with most US Medium sized cities with Corporations.
With no import tax on vehicles in an SEZ, the most popular cars are Mercedes and BMWs.
Not only are SEZs very profitable under Capitalism for the Corporations that reside there, but also for the Communist Party which receives about 90% of its total income from them.
